facts: Bears can run up to 40 miles per hour, faster than a racehorse.
A bear's sense of smell is 7 times better than a bloodhound's.
Polar bears have black skin underneath their white fur to absorb heat.
Giant pandas spend 12-16 hours a day eating bamboo.
Bears are one of the few animals that can see in color.
A group of bears is called a sloth or sleuth.
Grizzly bears can remember the faces of other bears for years.
Some bears can climb trees faster than they can run.
Bears don't actually hibernate - they enter a lighter sleep called torpor.
A polar bear's liver contains so much vitamin A it's toxic to humans.
Bears can walk on their hind legs like humans for short distances.
The sun bear has the longest tongue of any bear species, up to 10 inches.
Brown bears can weigh up to 1,500 pounds - as much as a small car.
Bears shake their heads from side to side when they want to play.
A mother bear is called a sow, a father is a boar, and babies are cubs.
Polar bears can swim for days without stopping, covering over 400 miles.
Bears have been known to use tools, like rocks to scratch themselves.
The spectacled bear is the only bear species native to South America.
